page.title: 02DUNDEE - VILLAGES TO WEST
page.content: {CARSE OF GOWRIE}-a strip of fertile,level country between the Sidlaw Hills and the River Tay noted for soft fruit cultivation. {INVERGOWRIE}village suburb of{DUNDEE. By-passed in{1985.}2 churches, bowling green.{ST. PETER'S CHURCH RUIN,}oldest church north of Tay.Small industrial units in disused paper mill. {KINGOODIE}village south of INVERGOWRIE Saltire Award for architecture "Britain in Bloom"commended. { {DENHEAD OF GRAY}small traditional rural community. {BENVIE}-as above- church ruin,1292.A.D {TAY ESTUARY}- noted for sea birds;shelducks,curlews,turnstones, pink-footed geese,herons and dunlins. {DUNDEE TECHNOLOGY PARK}incl.{PROSPECT {BUSINESS CENTRE}created as part of {ENTERPRISE}ZONE.
